metadata.Title: CVE-2012-0876 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The XML parser (xmlparse.c) in expat before 2.1.0 computes hash valueswithout restricting the ability to trigger hash collisions predictably,which allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (CPUconsumption) via an XML file with many identifiers with the same value.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-0876` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.1.0-1
lib64expat1 - 2.1.0-1
libexpat1 - 2.1.0-1
No subscription required

libxmlrpc-c++4 - 1.16.33-3.1ubuntu6
libxmlrpc-core-c3 - 1.16.33-3.1ubuntu6
xmlrpc-api-utils - 1.16.33-3.1ubuntu6
No subscription required

tla - 1.3.5+dfsg-15
No subscription required

criterions.comment: expat package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.0-1').
xmlrpc-c package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.16.33-3.1ubuntu6').
vnc4: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
xotcl: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
tla package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.5+dfsg-15').
